Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 4th overall pick, by Detroit in 1975...
Traded from Detroit to Los Angeles on 2/10/1975 (Going to DET: LF R. Santo Domingo. Going to LA: 2B L. Whitaker)...
Traded from Los Angeles to Philadelphia on 6/23/1975 (Going to LA: P H. Shank. Going to PHI: LF G. Richards, 2B L. Whitaker, P L. Andersen)...
Had first career hit on 8/24/1977, off Chuck Hartenstein (SF)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/9/1978, off Rich Gossage (CHC)...
Drove in 6 runs against Pittsburgh on 9/21/1980...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/14/1981, hitting .481 with 3 HR, 8 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/22/1981, hitting .500 with 1 HR, 4 RBI...
Was selected to the 1982 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/23/1984, hitting .524 with 1 HR, 5 RBI...
Was selected to the 1984 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Philadelphia in 1984...
Injured on 6/3/1985 with a Tight Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won World Series with Philadelphia in 1986...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1986...
